field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this Backend Pool

field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this Backend Pool.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this Backend Pool.

field.label: Mode
field.help: Set the running mode or protocol of the Backend Pool. Usually the Public Service and the Backend Pool are in the same mode.
field.hint: Set the same mode for backend and frontend.

field.label: Balancing Algorithm
field.help: Define the load balancing algorithm to be used in a Backend Pool. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Random Draws
field.help: When using the Random Balancing Algorithm, this value indicates the number of draws before selecting the least loaded of these servers.

field.label: Proxy Protocol
field.help: Enforces use of the PROXY protocol over any connection established to the configured servers. The PROXY protocol informs the other end about the layer 3/4 addresses of the incoming connection, so that it can know the client's address or the public address it accessed to, whatever the upper layer protocol. This setting must not be used if the servers are not aware of the PROXY protocol. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Servers
field.help: Add servers to this backend. Use TAB key to complete typing.
field.hint: Type server name or choose from list.

field.label: Resolver
field.help: Select the custom resolver configuration that should be used for all servers in this backend.

field.label: Resolver Options
field.help: Add resolver options. Use TAB key to complete typing.
field.hint: Type option name or choose from list.

field.label: Prefer IP Family
field.help: When DNS resolution is enabled for a server and multiple IP addresses from different families are returned, HAProxy will prefer using an IP address from the selected family.

field.label: Source address
field.help: Sets the source address which will be used when connecting to the server(s).

field.label: Enable Health Checking
field.help: Enable or disable health checking.

field.label: Health Monitor
field.help: Select Health Monitor for servers in this backend.

field.label: Log Status Changes
field.help: Enable to log health check status updates.

field.label: Check Interval
field.help: Sets the interval (in milliseconds) for running health checks on all configured servers. This setting takes precedence over default values in health monitors and real servers.

field.label: Down Interval
field.help: Sets the interval (in milliseconds) for running health checks on a configured server when the server state is DOWN. If it is not set HAProxy uses the check interval.

field.label: Unhealthy Threshold
field.help: The number of consecutive unsuccessful health checks before a server is considered as unavailable.

field.label: Healthy Threshold
field.help: The number of consecutive successful health checks before a server is considered as available.

field.label: E-Mail Alert
field.help: Select an e-mail alert configuration. An e-mail is sent when the state of a server changes.

field.label: Enable HTTP/2
field.help: Enable support for end-to-end HTTP/2 communication.

field.label: HTTP/2 without TLS
field.help: Enable support for HTTP/2 even if TLS is not enabled.

field.label: Advertise Protocols (ALPN)
field.help: When using the TLS ALPN extension, HAProxy advertises the specified protocol list as supported on top of ALPN. TLS must be enabled.

field.label: Persistence type
field.help: Choose how HAProxy should track user-to-server mappings. Stick-table persistence works with all protocols, but is broken in multi-process and multithreaded modes. Cookie-based persistence only works with HTTP/HTTPS protocols.

field.label: Cookie handling
field.help: Usually it is better to reuse an existing cookie. In this case HAProxy prefixes the cookie with the required information. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Cookie name
field.help: Cookie name to use for persistence.

field.label: Strip quotes
field.help: Enable to automatically strip quotes from the cookie value. Some broken HTTP clients add quotes, which breaks persistence.

field.label: Table type
field.help:
Choose a request pattern to associate a user to a server. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.
NOTE: Consider not using this feature in multi-process mode, it can result in random behaviours.

field.label: Stored data types
field.help: This is used to store additional information in the stick-table. It may be used by ACLs in order to control various criteria related to the activity of the client matching the stick-table. Note that this directly impacts memory usage. See the HAProxy documentation for a full description.

field.label: Expiration time
field.help: Enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "d" (days), "h" (hour), "m" (minute), "s" (seconds), "ms" (miliseconds). This configures the maximum duration of an entry in the stick-table since it was last created, refreshed or matched. The maximum duration is slightly above 24 days.

field.label: Size
field.help: Enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "k", "m", "g". This configures the maximum number of entries that can fit in the table. This value directly impacts memory usage. Count approximately 50 bytes per entry, plus the size of a string if any.

field.label: Cookie name
field.help: Cookie name to use for stick table (if appropiate table type is selected).

field.label: Cookie length
field.help: The maximum number of characters that will be stored in the stick table (if appropiate table type is selected).

field.label: Connection rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming connection rate over that period, in connections per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Session rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming session rate over that period, in sessions per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP request rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average HTTP request rate over that period, in requests per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: HTTP error rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average HTTP request error rate over that period, in requests per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Bytes in rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average incoming bytes rate over that period, in bytes per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Bytes out rate period
field.help: The length of the period over which the average is measured. It reports the average outgoing bytes rate over that period, in bytes per period. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Enable
field.help: Enable HTTP Basic Authentication.

field.label: Allowed Users
field.hint: Type username or choose from list.

field.label: Allowed Groups
field.hint: Type group or choose from list.

field.label: Connection Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum time to wait for a connection attempt to a server to succeed. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Check Timeout
field.help: Sets an additional read timeout for running health checks on a server. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Server Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the server side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Retries
field.help: Set the number of retries to perform on a server after a connection failure.

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help: These lines will be added to the HAProxy backend configuration.

field.label: Default for server
field.help: Default option for all server entries.

field.label: Use Frontend port
field.help: Don't use port on server, use the same port as frontend receive. If check enable, require port check in server.

field.label: HTTP reuse
field.help: Declare how idle HTTP connections may be shared between requests.

field.label: Enable Caching
field.help: Enable caching of responses from this backend. The HAProxy cache must be enabled under Settings before this will have any effect.

field.label: Select Rules
field.help: Choose rules to be included in this Backend Pool.

field.label: Select Error Messages
field.help: Choose error messages to be included in this Backend Pool.
